title: #303 Increasing Your AI Maturity | Iwo Szapar & Eryn Peters, Founders at AI Maturity Index

rawLines.text: Welcome to Dataf Framed. This is Richie.
In order to know which way to go, you
first need to know where you are. As
well as being good advice for finding a
way around town, it's also good advice
for getting better at using AI. For
large organizations, knowing where you
are with AI is easier said than done
since different teams will have
different needs and different
capabilities. What you need is an AI
maturity assessment. Essentially, a GPS
for organizational AI positioning. Today
we're going to find out how to measure
your organization's AI maturity and what
to do next once you know where you are.
Our guests are the founders of AI
Maturity Index, a company that has, as
you might imagine, created an AI
maturity index. Evo Chappelle is an
entrepreneur, strategic adviser, and
community builder. Erin Peters is a
future of work evangelist. She regularly
advises companies on how to assess and
improve their AI maturity. So let's find
out how to increase our AI maturity.
Every company is kind of a tech company
now, right? Like if you think of anyone
in the world, whether it's a
veterinarian's office or anything else,
they're all tech enabled. And this is
really the era that we're entering with
AI is that everything is going to have
some level of AI integrated in the
tools, systems, processes, and and
everything that we're doing within
business. One of the best tactics that
that really works for organizations is
to organize hackathons. What is really
cool here is that you're building
solutions for your own problems, for
your own challenges, right? Um so you
can immediately see potential value that
it then create which then immediately um
creates a buying for for for such tools.
Hi Erin, hi Evo, welcome to the show.
Thanks for having us. Great to be here.
Thank you. Excellent. So uh just to
begin with, I'd like a bit of
motivation. So it's often not clear what

So do you have any examples of companies
